**The Middle Category of the Luminous Statutes of the Nine Perfected of the Mysterious Capital: Admonitions and Punishments**

**The First Scroll of the Middle Category of the Mysterious Capital states:**

Among later disciples, those whose seven generations of ancestors have committed murder, robbery, plunder, treachery, usurpation, or rebellion; whose nine clans have conspired in treason; or whose transgressions have accumulated in the Nine Yin—such offenses are grave, their grievances and retributions bound in the Nine Darknesses, beyond absolution. Their descendants, burdened by residual calamity, may not partake in the true scriptures or secretly receive the sacred writs. If one possesses a steadfast resolve and aspires to self-betterment, they must first repent before the Seven Mysteries, perform meritorious deeds, liberate imprisoned souls, and expose themselves beneath the Three Luminaries, loosening their hair and prostrating in repentance for three years without ceasing. They must present a substantial offering and cast it into the Nine Rivers to redeem past delusions. Only then, after a hundred-day purification fast, may they receive the sacred scriptures and proceed. Should one bear the sins of heaven yet fail to first punish and reproach themselves, or presume to receive the celestial treasures, both master and disciple shall suffer the trial of the wind-blade. Their seven ancestral lineages shall be eternally confined to the Dark Abyss, burdened with stones and mountains, never to be released. Their bodies shall perish, the scriptures lost, and they shall never attain immortality. Be ever vigilant.

**The Second Scroll of the Middle Category of the Mysterious Capital states:**

Those who wish to cultivate the supreme Dao yet bear grave sins—having taken lives with their own hands, cruelly oppressed the lowly, slaughtered living beings, plundered the common folk, schemed in treachery, conspired with their nine clans, envied the worthy, or rebelled against their masters—such unforgivable offenses, accumulated in the Nine Yin, bar them from receiving the wondrous Dao or practicing the scriptures. If one possesses a steadfast resolve, they must first confess their crimes, perform meritorious deeds, expose themselves beneath the Three Luminaries, loosen their hair and prostrate in repentance for three years, present an offering and cast it into the river to atone for their transgressions, and liberate their seven ancestral lineages to be distinguished in the Three Realms. Only then, after a hundred-day purification fast, may they receive the sacred scriptures and proceed. Should one bear such sins yet fail to first confess, punish themselves, and strive for self-betterment before receiving the scriptures, both master and disciple shall suffer the trial of the wind-blade, endure the ten torments and eight calamities, their souls lost to the Dark Springs. The scriptures shall naturally be lost, and their seven ancestors and parents shall be eternally bound to the Dark Paths, never to be released. Disciples, be ever cautious.

**The Third Scroll of the Middle Category of the Mysterious Capital states:**

Among disciples who receive the Three Wondrous Treasures, the *Supreme Clarity* secret scriptures, yet recklessly disclose their catalogues, reveal their contents to the unworthy, or profane the sacred chapters, for a first to tenth offense, they shall be punished with three years of severed merit and suspended practice, after which they may resume purification and cultivation. For offenses beyond this, their sins shall accumulate in the Nine Yin, their punishment extending to the seven ancestral lineages, condemning them to servitude in the Three Paths, hauling stones and mountains, enduring the ten torments and eight calamities. Only after ten thousand kalpas may they be released, yet they shall be reborn into the inhuman realms. Their own bodies shall suffer the trial of the wind-blade, lose their sight, and be maimed, dying as lowly ghosts, forever forfeiting immortality. Those who transmit these teachings must be ever vigilant.

**The Fourth Scroll of the Middle Section of the Mysterious Capital states:** All disciples who receive the precious scriptures of the Supreme Clarity or the Three Wondrous Treasure Texts must not weep, approach corpses, or remain in places defiled by blood or filth. For a first to tenth offense, they shall be punished with one year of severed merit and suspended practice, after which they may follow the regulations to atone, expiating their sins in the Great Yin, and then resume purification and cultivation. For offenses beyond this, up to twenty-four, their lifespan shall be diminished, and their Jade Boys and Jade Maidens shall return to their original palaces. Within three years, they shall lose the scriptures and forfeit their lives, while their seven ancestral lineages shall be condemned to eternal ghostly servitude, never to be released for ten thousand kalpas. Disciples, be vigilant.

**The Fifth Scroll of the Middle Section of the Mysterious Capital states:** All disciples who receive the precious scriptures of the Supreme Clarity or the Three Caverns’ secret texts must not approach women or frequent defiled and turbid places, lest they pollute their true qi. For ten to twenty-four offenses, they shall be punished with three hundred days of severed merit and suspended practice, after which they may resume purification and cultivation. For offenses beyond this, their Jade Boys and Jade Maidens shall each return to their original palaces, their lifespan shall be shortened, and within three years, they shall lose the scriptures and perish, while their seven ancestors shall suffer punishment. Disciples, be vigilant.

**The Sixth Scroll of the Middle Section of the Mysterious Capital states:** All disciples who receive the precious scriptures of the Supreme Clarity or the Three Caverns’ secret texts must not harbor malicious intent, commit acts of violence, kill living beings, engage in plunder or treachery, slander the worthy, envy the capable, attack those of shared qi, or undermine their scripture masters. For a first to fifth offense, they shall be permitted to atone by pledging sincerity, making amends in the Nine Yin, expiating their sins in the Five Marchmounts, and enduring ten years of severed merit and suspended practice, after which they may resume purification and continue their cultivation. For offenses beyond five, up to twenty-four, the Four Offices shall execute them, seizing their hun and po souls to serve as laborers in the Northern Feng, while their seven ancestors shall be condemned to servitude. After ten thousand kalpas, they may be released, yet they shall be reborn into the inhuman realms. Their Jade Boys and Jade Maidens shall each return to the Upper Palaces, and within one year, they shall lose the scriptures and perish, forever forfeiting immortality. Disciples, be vigilant.

**The Seventh Scroll of the Middle Section of the Mysterious Capital states:** All disciples who receive the precious scriptures of the Supreme Clarity or the Three Caverns’ secret texts must not urinate while facing north, consume the five pungent vegetables or bloody meats, drink wine, engage in licentiousness, violate the Dao, disdain the Dharma, or harbor doubt and divided devotion. For ten to twenty-four offenses, they shall be permitted to atone according to the regulations by pledging sincerity, making amends in the Great Yin, enduring one year of severed merit, and then resuming purification for ninety days before continuing their cultivation. For offenses beyond this, their lifespan shall be shortened, their bodies shall suffer the trial of the wind-blade, and their seven ancestral lineages shall be condemned to servitude in the Three Paths. Within five years, they shall lose the scriptures and perish. Disciples, be vigilant.

**The Eighth Scroll of the Middle Section of the Mysterious Capital states:** All disciples who receive the precious scriptures of the Supreme Clarity or the Three Caverns’ secret texts must, in accordance with the regulations, present their pledge and visit their master to announce their purification before receiving the scriptures. They must not recklessly reveal the sacred texts without first making a vow. If they obtain the scriptures from ordinary people and then take them as masters to transmit the teachings, such transmission is permissible, but they must not lightly transcribe or alter the sacred texts, interpret them arbitrarily, corrupt the ancient pronunciations, or devise their own methods. The Four Offices shall investigate such transgressions, and their sins shall be recorded in the Nine Yin. For a first to third offense, they shall endure three years of severed merit and suspended practice, atone according to the regulations, present their pledge to the Nine Rivers, and then purify themselves for thirty days before resuming their cultivation. For offenses beyond this, up to twenty-four, their Jade Boys and Jade Maidens shall each return to their original palaces, their lifespan shall be diminished, their bodies shall be consigned to the ghostly officials, and their seven ancestral lineages shall be condemned to eternal ghostly servitude. After ten thousand kalpas, they may be released, yet they shall be reborn into the inhuman realms. Disciples, be vigilant.

**The Ninth Scroll of the Middle Section of the Mysterious Capital states:** All who receive the precious scriptures of the Supreme Clarity or the Three Wondrous Treasure Texts must place them in a separate chamber upon a high bed, four feet and four inches in height and five inches in width, to enshrine the received scriptures. They shall keep lamps lit and burn incense, offering morning and evening reverence and prayers, always making offerings. They must not allow those of impure qi, defiled or polluted persons, or women to enter the chamber, lest they offend the divine perfected. These are the regulations observed in the world. Those who receive the scriptures must not wear clothing, sandals, or other items shared with the uninitiated; in rest, repose, sitting, and rising, they must always remain distinct from ordinary things. For a first to twenty-fourth offense, they shall be punished with one year of severed merit and suspended practice, after which they may resume purification and cultivation. For offenses beyond this, they shall be seized by the Four Offices, their transgressions reported to the Jade Clarity, and their names returned to Fengdu. Within seven years, they shall lose the scriptures and perish, while their seven ancestors shall suffer punishment. Disciples, be vigilant.

**The Lower Section of the Redemption of Sins in the Luminous Regulations of the Nine Perfected of the Mysterious Capital**

**The First Scroll of the Lower Section of the Mysterious Capital states:** If any later disciple’s seven ancestors or parents committed in their lifetimes the sins described in the first scroll of the Upper or Middle Sections of the Mysterious Capital, their punishment shall be especially severe, their sins bound in the Nine Yin, their seven ancestors becoming vengeful adversaries, suffering eternal torment in the dark realms, their misfortunes extending to their descendants, and their spectral bonds never released. They must prostrate themselves beneath the Great Yin, their hair unbound, kowtowing to confess their sins to the Nine Yin and self-recriminate for three years. At the end of the year, they shall present nine pairs of golden rings, one liang of green silk, and one golden figurine, casting them into the mouth of the Three Rivers to redeem the sins of their seven ancestors and deliver their souls from the trials of the dark realms. The regulations require a peachwood tablet inscribed in red with five lines, recording: *"On such-and-such a day, month, and year, so-and-so of such-and-such a prefecture, county, village, and hamlet, Wang Jia, on behalf of his seven ancestors, parents, and himself, having committed the sins described in the first scroll of the Upper and Middle Sections of the Mysterious Capital, with sins bound in the Nine Yin, now respectfully presents nine pairs of golden rings and one golden figurine in accordance with the regulations to redeem the cruel punishments of the dark souls, casting this document to report his fate and return his confession to the Water Palace, thereby dissolving his sins, extinguishing the records of the Three Offices, and allowing the souls to ascend to the Nine Heavens."* Upon completion, the items and tablet shall be bound with green silk and sunk with a green stone. At the moment of sinking, they shall face north, kowtow, and recite the incantation:

The Nine Lords of the Great Yin govern the spirit-officials. Jia now makes this declaration, returning it to the River Source, casting the missive into the Nine Springs, to extricate the Seven Mysteries, dissolve all karmic grievances, and allow my person to ascend as an immortal.

Thus concluded.
Through this, the trials of the seven ancestors shall be released, freed from the Dark Palace, and ascend to the Hall of Blessings. My person may then proceed to study the precious scriptures, and after nine years, true spirits shall descend in form, ascending together with the gods. The Mysterious Regulations are most severe—transgress them no further.

The second scroll of the Lower Section of the Mysterious Capital states: Those who wish to cultivate the Dao of the Supreme Perfected, if they have previously committed sins described in the second scroll of the Upper and Middle Sections, with trials bound in the Nine Yin, their sins coiled in the netherworld, extending to the seven ancestors, their trials and suffering souls entangled without release—must first, beneath the Great Yin, face north with unbound hair, kowtow, and confess their sins to the Three Lights, fulfilling three years of penance. Upon completion of the year, they shall present one *jin* of cinnabar, one inscribed knife, one *liang* of green silk, and one golden figurine, casting them into the confluence of the Three Rivers to redeem their own cruel and rebellious transgressions, dissolve the knots of the Three Offices, and extricate the seven ancestors. The regulations require writing in cinnabar on a one-*chi* length of green silk, recording as follows: "On such-and-such a year, month, and day of the new moon, so-and-so of such-and-such prefecture, county, village, and hamlet, Wang Jia, aged so-and-so, having no prior witness to his conduct, has violated the Mysterious Regulations, committing primordial evil, incurring the sins of the second scroll of the Upper and Middle Sections of the Mysterious Capital, with sins bound in the Great Yin. Now, in accordance with the regulations, he presents one golden figurine, one *jin* of cinnabar, and one inscribed knife to continue the redemption of his own foul and wicked sins, casting this document to report his fate and return his confession to the Spirits, thereby dissolving his sins, extinguishing the records of the Nine Rivers, and attaining longevity." Upon completion, bind the items and text with green silk and sink them with a green stone. At the moment of sinking, face north, kowtow, and recite the incantation:

Above are the Nine Lords of the Great Yin who govern the affairs. Jia now makes this declaration, returning it to the River Source, to redeem sins and dissolve knots, extricate the Nine Trials, and allow grievance-bound souls and spirits to each return to their natural state. May misfortune be extinguished and the study of immortality achieved, that my person may ascend.

Thus concluded.
Through this, the knots of the Nine Yin shall be untied, and the souls of karmic grievances shall return to their natural state. One may then proceed to study the scriptures of the Supreme Clarity, and after nine years without fail, true spirits shall descend in form, uniting with the gods in the unseen. The Mysterious Regulations are most severe—transgress them no further.

The third scroll of the Lower Section of the Mysterious Capital states: Those who study the precious scriptures of the Supreme Clarity and the secret texts of the Cavern Mystery, if they have committed sins described in the third scroll of the Upper and Middle Sections, with trials bound in the Great Yin and reported to the Jade Clarity by the Four Offices—shall sever their merits and restrain themselves, enter the chamber to burn incense, kowtow in self-reproach, face north, and click their teeth ten times, raising their heads to pray:

O profound and distant Mysterious Primordial, rarely heard in the lower world, I have lightly divulged the precious truth, offending the august honor of the Emperor. I submit myself to bear responsibility, prostrating at the Gate of the Spirits. I humbly beseech the Most High to bestow the grace of the Mysterious, descend with numinous response, and awaken the natural.

Thus concluded, kowtow nine times. After three years of such confession, undertake a thirty-day purification fast, thereby dissolving the Three Offices, releasing the trials of the Nine Yin, and resuming cultivation. By treasuring and secretly reciting the scriptures, one may attain flight as an immortal. The Mysterious Regulations are most severe—transgress them no further.

The fourth scroll of the Lower Section of the Mysterious Capital states: Those who cultivate the Dao of the Supreme Perfected, if they have committed sins described in the fourth scroll of the Upper and Middle Sections, with sins bound in the Nine Yin and trials reported to the Jade Clarity—shall, at midnight in the central courtyard, light thirty-two lamps to cleanse impure *qi*, purifying both inner and outer. Enter the chamber to burn incense, face north, kowtow, and confess their transgressions, clicking their teeth thirty-six times, raising their heads to recite the incantation:

The world’s fortune wanes, corpse-ghosts obscure the path, impure *qi* swirls, clashing with the true. Violating regulations and breaking precepts, I have entered the realm of sin. I redeem myself through ritual and confession, washing away with bright lamps. May misfortune scatter from the Three Clarities, and blessings fill my prosperity. May the Dao’s shade flow in grace, its blessings boundless.

Thus concluded, kowtow nine more times. After one year of this, undertake a thirty-day purification fast, then resume cultivation, strictly adhering to the regulations, diligently focusing on the truth for nine years, and attain ascension at dawn. The Mysterious Regulations are most severe—transgress them no further.

The fifth scroll of the Lower Section of the Mysterious Capital states: Those who cultivate the Dao of the Supreme Perfected, if they have committed sins described in the fifth scroll of the Upper and Middle Sections, with sins bound in the Great Yin and trials suspended in the Azure Palace—shall prepare fragrant water for bathing, present oil in the central courtyard, and light twenty-four lamps for ninety days. Enter the chamber, face north, kowtow nine times, confess their transgressions, and click their teeth twenty-four times, raising their heads to recite the incantation:

Heaven and Earth, the two images in communion, yin *qi* mingling with the correct, impure *qi* overflowing. The spirit is lost, the treasure diminished, the Dharma’s countenance marred. I reverently set forth bright lamps to illuminate the Mysterious Palace. May misfortune be extinguished in the Nine Yin, and blessings return to the ancestral lineage.

Thus concluded. After ninety days, conclude the fast with twenty-four days of retreat, then resume the cultivation of the true Dharma. In every petition, be cautious, clearly follow the regulations, and attain union with the Mysterious Perfected as an immortal. The Mysterious Regulations are most severe—transgress them no further.

The sixth scroll of the Lower Section of the Mysterious Capital states: Those who cultivate the Dao of the Supreme Perfected, if they have committed sins described in the sixth scroll of the Upper and Middle Sections, with particularly grave sins seized by the Four Offices, trials bound in the Nine Yin, and confrontations in the Dark Palace—shall, beneath the Great Yin, with unbound hair and kowtowing, confess to the Jade Clarity and extricate the Great Yin. According to the regulations, they shall secretly distribute treasures to beg among the poor, providing meals for a hundred people to feed the hungry and destitute for ten years.

Enter the chamber, kowtow in self-reproach, face north, and click the teeth nine times. Look up and recite the incantation:

"Vast are heaven, broad is earth,
Nine springs unfold their gates.
This body treads the gate of calamity,
Its sins suspended in Jade Capital.
Nether ropes entangle, dark caverns cloud,
Yet scattering treasures lifts the guilt,
Bestowing alms to the destitute.
Sins dissolve in the Great Yin,
Blessings arise in ten directions.
Cast off the old, embrace the new—
Thus flourishes the unending."

When finished, kowtow nine more times to conclude.

This is the supreme method of absolving sins, recorded in the orthodox regulations. Practiced thus for ten years, all lingering sins and stagnant qi dissolve in the Great Yin. Upon completing a year of self-reproach and almsgiving, fast for a hundred days more, then return to cultivation. Examine the self and guard the precepts, transgress no further.

The seventh scroll of the Lower Section of the Mysterious Capital states: Those who study the Dao of the Supreme Perfected, if they have committed sins described in the seventh scroll of the Upper and Middle Sections—sins that fill the Upper Clarity—shall offer ten pounds of fine incense to fellow practitioners in ten gatherings, absolving one year of guilt.

Enter the chamber, burn incense, face east, and kowtow nine times. Bow in repentance to the Supreme Perfected, click the teeth nine times, look up, and recite the incantation:

"Five qi interweave,
The Supreme Perfected incomplete.
This body tainted by defiled qi,
Offends the gates of cavernous depths,
Harms the treasuries, severs life,
Shakes the Three Passes.
Violating regulations, breaking precepts,
Suffering trials, prolonging woe—
With reverent penance,
I report to the Imperial Honored Ones,
Begging to proclaim now:
Depart the lower realms,
Ascend to celestial immortality."

When finished, continue thus for a full year, then fast for twenty-four days before resuming cultivation. Only then may the true numinous powers descend.

The gravity of the sacred statutes forbids repeated transgressions.

The eighth section of the Lower Rank of Xuandu states: For those who study the Dao of the Supreme Perfected, if one commits sins listed in the eighth section of the Upper or Middle Ranks, and is seized by the supervisory officials, the case shall be bound and tried before the Three Clarities. The offender must take one *hu* of pure oil and kindle lamps in the central courtyard, the number to be as one wishes, until the oil is exhausted. Furthermore, offer ten *jin* of fine incense to a master who possesses the scriptures, to absolve three years of transgressions. Enter the chamber, burn incense, face north, and kowtow nine times. Bow in repentance for the offense committed, click the teeth twelve times, look up, and recite the incantation:

"The Celestial Perfected are lofty and distant,
The radiance of the Mysterious descends in clarity.
By virtue of past blessings,
I beheld the true scriptures.
Yet failing to grasp the Mysterious Statutes,
I slighted the numinous powers of Heaven,
Violated the true precepts,
And sank my person into darkness.
With reverent self-chastisement,
I report to the Supreme Clarity.
From this moment onward,
I shall cleanse my former form,
Uphold the Mysterious Perfected,
And align with the Dao as one."

When finished, complete a full three years, then fast for ninety days. Only after receiving transmission from a master may one resume cultivation. Those who have not yet received transmission must present offerings and visit a master to receive the scriptures and cultivate in accordance with the statutes, thereby attaining ascension.

The gravity of the Mysterious Statutes is profound—transgressions must not recur.

The ninth section of the Lower Rank of Xuandu states: For those who cultivate the Dao of the Supreme Perfected, if one commits sins listed in the ninth section of the Upper or Middle Ranks, the offense shall be bound to the Great Yin and suspended for trial in the Jade Clarity. The offender must kindle seven lamps before the hall, enter the chamber, kowtow, and confess the sin before the scriptures. Click the teeth twenty-four times, look up, and recite the incantation:

"The radiance of Jade Light descends,
Illuminating the Supreme Clarity.
Neglecting reverent offerings,
I violated the precious scriptures.
I fear the Four Administrations
Will list my crimes in the Purple Court.
With solemn fasting and devotion,
I beseech the true numinous powers
To condescend and descend,
Erasing my sins and dissolving my punishments.
I pledge to uphold the Mysterious Statutes,
Preserving my primordial integrity forever."

When finished, continue thus for a full year, then fast for twenty-four days before resuming the cultivation of what was received.

The gravity of the Mysterious Statutes is profound—one must be vigilant and avoid further transgressions.

The *Tai Xuan Jiu Zhen Ming Ke* comprises three ranks and twenty-seven clauses, originating from the Palace of Lingdu in the Supreme’s realm. These are treasured and concealed by the Supreme, never to be disseminated below. Now, the essential methods are excerpted and established for the sake of later sages, to elucidate the Three Marvels and inscribe them in the *Great Primordial Unadorned Numinous Scripture*. Those whose bones align with immortality may employ this text to absolve sins, resolve transgressions, untie knots, and disperse obstructions. The Seven Mysteries shall be no more, and after three years, the true numinous powers shall manifest, merging with you to ascend together to the Nine Heavens. To recklessly divulge the Mysterious Statutes incurs the same guilt as described above. They must be treasured in secrecy and practiced in confidentiality.

The *Nine Perfected of Xuandu* states: The transmission of scriptural titles listed in the Three Ranks of the Nine Perfected occurred when the Later Sage Lord first received the scriptures, which were bestowed upon him by the Supreme Dao Lord. The Supreme’s transmission of the scriptures emerged from the Three Ranks of Illuminated Statutes, to assist the Three Treasures of marvelous texts and the scriptures of the Supreme Perfected. The statutes and regulations for their application, along with the thirty-one scrolls, independent matters, and various scriptural rituals, are all contained within the *Illuminated Statutes of the Four Poles*. The Three Ranks of the Nine Perfected place the upper sections of the Three Primordials within the palaces of the Nine Emperors. The Four Poles, governed by the officials of the Four Administrations, oversee all prohibitions and punishments for transgressions. The *Illuminated Statutes of the Supreme Perfected*, received by the Supreme Lord from the Mysterious Chapters of the Celestial King of Primordial Beginning, contain the rituals and regulations of the Supreme Perfected. Their methods are concealed above the Nine Heavens, in the halls of the Supreme Lord, and their admonitions are stored in the palaces of the Supreme Perfected, never to be practiced in the world. The *Illuminated Statutes of the Nine Perfected* restrain later learners, while the *Illuminated Statutes of the Four Poles* govern the four directions. Their purport is subtle and profound, and without golden characters or jade inscriptions, they remain unknown. Those who obtain these texts need not study to achieve perfection.

The statutes exist to restrain sins; seeing the statutes, one reforms. To reform is to incur no deficit before Heaven and Earth; to incur no deficit before Heaven and Earth is to align with spontaneity. Aligning with spontaneity enables one to ascend and supplement the ranks of the true immortals. Without statutes, learning drifts ever farther from immortality.

The *Nine Perfected of Xuandu* states: For those of utmost aspiration whose names enter the Mysterious Palace, if one wishes to receive the Illuminated Statutes alone to understand the prohibitions of Heaven’s laws before receiving the scriptures, and upon verifying that one’s bones align with the Dao, one may first make a covenant and then receive them. The covenant’s ritual implements and offerings must adhere to the quantities prescribed in the *Three Marvels’ Precious Scriptures*, and the time limits shall be the same. They must not be lightly bestowed upon the unworthy, nor may the Mysterious Texts be revealed. To disregard the statutes’ purport is to consign oneself to the offices of ghosts, while one’s seven generations of ancestors shall tread upon the Knife Mountain and Sword Tree, never to be redeemed for ten thousand kalpas. Those who outwardly appear devoted but do not follow the statutes incur the same guilt as described in the statutes. The prohibitions for both parties are strict—practitioners, be vigilant!

The *Nine Perfected of Xuandu* states: Those who receive the supreme methods yet fail to uphold the Illuminated Statutes violate Heaven’s prohibitions, incurring guilt that burdens their seven generations of ancestors and brings trials upon themselves. Once one has reformed and chastised oneself, resuming cultivation of what was received, yet lapses again into transgression, the trials shall double those of the past. This indicates that one’s bones and destiny are unaligned, body and true nature at odds, the *po* soul consorting with ghosts—none may again reform and cultivate the true scriptures. I now elucidate the Illuminated Statutes to awaken those who remain unawakened. Once awakened, to transgress again—what purpose does that serve? Practitioners, be vigilant! Practitioners, be vigilant!

**The Supreme Lord’s Verse of Wondrous Praise for the Great Primordial**

In the dim vastness of primordial transformation,
The faint morning mist disperses.
Above the Great Stillness, in the empty mystery,
The Two Modes separate in clarity.
Congealing essence, embracing the empty womb,
Forming transformations, nurturing numinous vision.
Containing truth, nourishing the spirit within,
In a flash, the dark dawn breaks.
At last, I awaken to the sorrow of fleeting years,
As fate turns toward the celestial Han.
Whispering, I chant the *Steps of Emptiness*,
Circling to pay homage in the Jade Capital.
Bowing my head, I return to the Great Nonbeing,
Riding the wind, scattering numinous fragrance.
Gazing up and down in the halls of emperors,
I drift and soar with the void.
Wondrous songs emit strange sounds,
Chanting the verses of the Supreme Perfected.
Flowing through the Four Great Realms,
The measure of the Ten Heavens knows no bounds.

The Terrace of Mystery emits the dark night’s glow,
Divine candles spout wondrous light.
Resplendent, the jade forest’s blossoms gleam,
Their radiance dazzling the jasper halls.
Void-born, the natural mist arises,
Lush and dense, it upholds the dark net.
The host of Perfected unfurl the clouds in praise,
Jewel canopies rise with the wind.
Flying steps chant the *Songs of Emptiness*,
Divine hymns transform and lengthen the Dao.
Profound and vast, the Great Transformation flourishes,
Solemn and grand, this Dao now thrives.
Accumulated study responds to the sun’s influence,
Merit complete, one enters the Great Vehicle.
Blessings and joy extend to all,
The seven ancestors all ascend.
Aligning the carriage, one soars past Mount Taihua,
Turning the reins, one leaves the Cloud Pavilion far behind.
Divine winds stir the empty vastness,
Fragrant flowers ride the mist and scatter.
Whispering, one pays homage in the Hall of Emptiness,
In orderly ranks, one treads the dark Han.
Bright chants awaken the hidden heart,
Delivering from the karmic roots of old.
The Five Sufferings dissolve in due time,
Fragrance flows into the vessel of refinement.
The Dark Gate towers amid the cloud-net,
Flying rosy clouds wing the numinous chariot.
Lifting the traceless Perfected,
One enters the Great Void in subtle grace.
Riding the void, one recites the jade scriptures,
Desolate and serene, one chants the feathered writ.
Vast mindfulness pervades all without exception,
All things abound in joy and surplus.

The Heavenly Emperor’s Hymn of Praise:
The Supreme Dao arises from empty stillness,
Dark echoes seek one another in shadow.
The Three Perfected are fundamentally one in origin,
Qi transforms—principles return yet differ.
The Dharma-wheel turns within the formless,
Drifting and flowing in pure vision.
The congealed verses require no thought,
Qi coalesces, uniting with the dark tally.
Divine chants emit the *Songs of Emptiness*,
Chanting and wandering the void in play.
The dark transformation leaves no trace,
Yet traces give rise to the Dao’s lineage.
Roaming the nine heavens’ expanse,
One rests the carriage at the Six Peaks’ palace.
Lifting the exalted guests,
One returns to the Primordial Numinous Chamber.
The Dao flows freely within the vast and desolate,
Divine songs resound in the Great Void.
Forms respond in the Court of Supreme Stillness,
Thoughts and chants connect the subtle and distant.
Light veils the lingering dawn’s glow,
Radiance shades the Jade Capital’s grounds.
The dark dragon requires no carriage,
Whispering, one soars the void in flight.
Hand plucking the seven-jeweled blossoms,
Divine winds scatter wondrous fragrance.
Wondrous chants arise from the heart’s depths,
Brilliant and bright, they reveal the jade verses.
The myriad qi merge as one in the Primordial,
All return to the Three Mysteries’ beam.
Riding the heavens, one does not call them high,
Gazing afar, the Nine Darks stretch boundless.
Flapping wings, one longs for the dark reins,
Yearning to ascend, one admires the cloudy skies.
Accumulated mindfulness invokes divine response,
Hoping to commune with the Jade Perfected.
Dim and bright, the celestial Han clears,
Drifting and floating, the radiant clouds return.
The Three Perfected soar into the void,
Guiding the reins swiftly to the Purple Tenuity.
Bright chants deliver the later selves,
All are bidden to ride the radiance and fly.
Delivering from the Three Paths’ trials,
The Nine Darks’ bitter sorrows dissolve.

The Heavenly Emperor of the Grand Tenuity intones:
The Supreme Perfected arises from the empty cavern,
Jasper gauze illumines the jeweled terrace.
Circling, one pays homage in the Dark Capital,
The host of immortals chant subtle verses.
Turning within the traceless,
Void songs harmonize with hidden trysts.
Delivering the self, one ascends to heaven,
Chanting and reciting, one lays the foundation of blessings.
Urging the reins toward the Rosy Clouds’ pavilion,
From time to time, one feasts amid the radiant clouds.
Drifting and floating without bounds,
Leaving suffering, one enters the Dark Gate.
The mind at ease, the Dao flows freely,
The cinnabar heart and will also part.
Accumulated study renews with each day,
Chanting my Primordial Numinous Writ.
The Eight Radiances drive the heavenly chariot,
Flying clouds gather the dark numen.
The plain canopy rides the wind in return,
Vast and distant, one enters the Purple Clarity.
Wondrous hymns praise the myriad Perfected’s melodies,
Jade echoes—how clear and ringing!
Delivering from the Nine Yin’s registers,
The self returns to the Southern Court.
Joy flows universally to all,
Wondrous transformations flourish without exception.
Pure and still, the Dark Dao’s lineage,
Bright and clear, it illumines the Great Void.
Wondrous transformations arise from silent stillness,
Subtle thoughts dwell in the Three Primes’ palace.
Accumulated mindfulness pierces the dark void,
Subtle and faint, the Supreme Dao connects.
Knocking and chanting resound in the dark stillness,
Divine hymns flourish without fail.
Cinnabar radiance reflects the numinous court,
Purple mist illumines the jade forest.
Resplendent, the seven-jeweled blossoms gleam,
Dazzling, they sway with the numinous sound.
Gong and shang harmonize of themselves,
Wondrous essence captivates the heart.
Dark hymns sow the fields of blessings,
Vast deliverance knows no bounds.

The Golden Portal Emperor of Later Saints intones:
Vast and boundless, the Primordial Heaven of Origin,
The Three Images merge as one in the dark.
Whispering, the true Dao thrives,
Vast and grand, the Great Vehicle soars.
The six qi return to the true court,
All converge in the Mud-Pill Chamber.
Entering and exiting, one roams the Emperor’s halls,
Flowing essence illumines the clouds and sun.
Circulating, one returns to the celestial Han,
Subtle and graceful, one rides the dark seven.
Round blossoms reflect the luminous pearl,
The two radiant scenes face the true light.
Numinous brilliance initiates the soaring assembly,
Dark images intertwine with Fusang.
Dark deliverance seeks itself,
Yin flows freely, brightening the eight wastes.
If one can consume this essence,
One will long uphold the dark net.
Playing in the Nine Darks’ terrace,
Resting at ease on the western feathered slope.
Divine beasts sing in the jasper halls,
Flying phoenixes intermingle in flight.
Void-born, the natural hymns arise,
Perfected ones chant in harmonious rhythm.
Transforming the self amid the kalpa’s trials,
Incense and destiny summon the pure song.
Establishing merit, founding fields of blessings,
Delivering the later selves from the net.
The seven darks scatter from the hidden palace,
Dark departures know no hardship.
Flying steps tread the cloudy peaks,
Soaring wings reach the Eastern Flower Palace.
Winds and clouds chant within the void,
Jade sounds scatter in the jasper halls.
Perfected ones chant the *Songs of Emptiness*,
Wondrous echoes fill the empty chambers.
Unbinding my natural heart,
Perfecting my kalpas of accumulated merit.
Long whistling above the Nine Darks,
Clear gaze beholds the empty same.
Dragons sing beyond the abodes,
Phoenixes cry in the Grand Empyrean’s halls.
Void hymns leave no lingering taste,
Mournful sounds ride the wind and scatter.
Who can fathom these verses?
Reciting the Primordial Numinous Hymns with precision
Dissolves the Nine Yin’s transgressions,
Delivers from the Seven Darks’ trials.

The Supreme Perfected of the Great Ultimate states: *The Wondrous Scripture of the Primordial Cavern’s Dark Mystery* arises with the Origin’s co-emergence. Since the numinous writ exists, the host of Perfected approach the seat, burn incense, pay homage to the scripture, and circumambulate while reciting these twenty-one chapters to celebrate in the divine court. The jade sounds ring clear, piercing the nine heavens. Their phrases are subtle and profound, wondrous essence branching in all directions. Reciting them once awakens the myriad spirits. Constant study and practice unite one with the Emperor in truth, dissolve the heavy burdens of past transgressions, deliver the Seven Darks from the hidden palace, release the Five Sufferings from sorrowful souls, and enable the self to ascend to heaven. Wondrous and subtle indeed—this numinous writ!

Here ends *The Wondrous Scripture of the Primordial Cavern’s Dark Mystery, Great and Profound*.

The character "脐" was originally written as "齐," amended here according to context.

chunks.original_text: 洞真太上素灵洞元大有妙经 经名：洞真太上素灵洞元大有妙经。 简称《大有妙经》。 撰人不详，约出於东晋南期。 是早期上清派『三奇宝文』之一。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 洞真太上素灵洞元大有妙经 目录#1： 三洞混化#2内真变生官号宝名 太上道君守三元真一经 太上道君元丹上经 四宫雌真一内神宝名玉诀 太上大洞守一内经法 太上三九素语内祝诀 太真隐朝求仙上法 太上九真明科 太帝君偈大有妙赞 三洞混化内真变生官号宝名 《太上素灵洞元大有妙经》，三九素语元丹上化三真九洞之道，本与元气同存，元始俱生，三精凝化，结朗玉章，构演三洞之府，揔御万真之渊，乃秘在九天之上大有之宫，金台玉室素灵房中，刻玉为简，以撰其文，金镂玉字，以明其篇。 混化三洞，变生上元，中统十绝虚生之天，下理万炁，无幽不关也。 流光元蔼，郁乎玉清，飞霞紫烟，耀焕太空。 玉华之女、金晨之童，各三千人，侍卫灵文。 於时天元值合，庆嘉神庭，元皇玉帝，无上高尊，群真众仙，莫不诣座，烧香礼经，旋行上宫也。 玄晨冥滞，飞香翳光，扬芳濯灵，散烟玉京，三素元云，流电霞峰，华光交焕，神烛合明，侍女众仙，有十亿万人，毒龙巨兽，备卫灵阙，蟒蛇击剑，长牙扣锺，天威焕赫，变乎太无，八风鼓於玄旌，玉音发於灵宫，凤鸣九霞之侧，鸾唱紫霄之傍，蓊霭玄玄之上，萧萧始晖之中。 是时天帝君、南极上元君、太微天帝君、后圣九玄金阙帝君，清斋三月，仰禀太冥，玄思感於太寂，积念启於上清，遂致皓映停晖，九纬缠形，隐芝结秀，宝光夜生，餐味华元，上注晨精，乘空结烟，八道焕明，咀嚼太和，慧畅玉篇，徘徊幽微，流逸霄庭，浩浩洞源，悠悠亿龄，容与大化，神秀无穷也。 耽栖灵观，洞宴七晨，澄濯华园，息憩九玄，变景玉虚，携领诸天，寥朗二顺，元庆亿津，流盼极劫，挹趣忘旋，沐浴灵丘，兰颖清岭，明范既维，内韵齐全，五华耀藏，皓莹琼心，窈窕绝宅，紫晖洞衿，振策玄河，擿绛惠林，周盼广域之内，目朗十天之音，眇眇神迹，无形可寻，灵化既隐，乘运玄清，条畅纯和，空胎结形，大有之妙观，演於素灵，九天之秘奥，元洞之凝精，理三关於幽府，揔万真於来生，制玄科以检违，赎己愆於太冥，拔七祖於三涂，度穷魂於南庭，诵三帝之慧唱，荡氛秽於三清。 大哉玉章，神德之至灵也。 《大洞真经三十九章》，上皇之道标，紫晨之妙篇，制命九天之阶，征召五帝之灵，逸回风之混合，凝九转於玄精，交会雌雄，混化万神，森罗幽郁，琼响太真，运辟非於明梁，通易有於玄门，洞德刃以造妙，濯耀罗以映云，太漠为灵关之气，无刃为浩劫之年，巍巍神馆，万真之渊，金房焕赫，郁乎上清，其旨幽微，难可究详。 若能长斋，绝志人门，诵玉篇於幽室，叩琼音以震灵，则真人定箓於东华，七玄更润於紫庭，制魔王以威神，摄五帝以卫身。 此大洞之奇神，揔亿道而反生，自无奇毛异质，金骨玉名，皆不得有妄披於灵文，其禁悉依《九真明科》，受者慎焉。 《高上玉检雌一五老宝经》，上愿十二，玄母八间，九转五回，变化雌雄，第二奇文，高上之极章，混化万变，理命长存，固魂凝精，领摄群神，解脱释结，回元五通，万炁总归，上镇泥丸，陶注极真，华映紫庭，飘飖朗於九玄，洞畅焕乎玉清，灵烟散馥於明霞，神灯朗耀於太空，群真庆轩於琼房，众仙诵赞而礼经，飞兽踊跃於太空，鸾凤嘈囐而悲鸣，三光停曜，天晖昼冥，浩汗幽馆，高上之极真也。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Supreme Cavern-Perfected Wondrous Scripture of Primordial Simplicity and Numinous Mystery of the Great Existence**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Cavern-Perfected Wondrous Scripture of Primordial Simplicity and Numinous Mystery of the Great Existence* (abbreviated as *The Wondrous Scripture of Great Existence*).
Author unknown, approximately composed during the late Eastern Jin dynasty. One of the "Three Rare Treasures" of the early Shangqing tradition. One scroll.
Source text: *Daoist Canon of the Orthodox Unity*, Zhengyi Section, Part One.

---

### **Table of Contents**
1. **The Harmonious Fusion of the Three Caverns** – *The Precious Names of the Offices and Titles of the Inner Perfected, Transformed and Born*
2. *The Scripture of the Supreme Dao Lord Guarding the Three Primes and the Perfected One*
3. *The Supreme Scripture of the Primordial Cinnabar*
4. *The Jade Instructions on the Precious Names of the Inner Spirits of the Four Palaces and the Feminine Perfected One*
5. *The Method of the Supreme Great Cavern for Guarding the One Within*
6. *The Inner Incantations of the Three Nines and the Plain Words*
7. *The Supreme Method of the Concealed Court for Seeking Immortality*
8. *The Luminous Regulations of the Nine Perfected*
9. *The Supreme Emperor Lord’s Verses: The Wondrous Praises of Great Existence*

---

### **The Harmonious Fusion of the Three Caverns – The Precious Names of the Offices and Titles of the Inner Perfected, Transformed and Born**

*The Wondrous Scripture of Primordial Simplicity and Numinous Mystery of the Great Existence* expounds the Dao of the Three Perfected and the Nine Caverns, transformed from the Upper Cinnabar and the Plain Words of the Three Nines. Coeval with primordial qi, born together with the Primordial Beginning, the Three Essences congealed and crystallized, inscribing luminous jade tablets. It unfolds the palaces of the Three Caverns, governing the abyss of the myriad Perfected. Secretly enshrined in the Palace of Great Existence above the Nine Heavens, within the Golden Terrace and Jade Chamber of the Simplicity and Numinous Abode, its text was carved upon jade slips, its characters engraved in gold and jade to illumine its chapters.

The harmonious fusion of the Three Caverns gives birth to the Upper Prime, centrally governing the Ten Absolute Void-Born Heavens, and below, ordering the myriad qi—no mystery remains untouched. Its flowing radiance and primordial mist rise in jadelike purity; flying rosy clouds and purple mists illumine the Great Void. The Jade-Flower Maidens and Golden Dawn Youths, each three thousand in number, attend and guard the numinous scripture.

At that time, when the celestial primes aligned and the divine court rejoiced, the Primordial Jade Emperor, the Most High and Venerable, was enthroned, while the host of Perfected and immortals assembled before his seat. They burned incense, paid homage to the scripture, and circumambulated the Upper Palace.

In the profound obscurity of the Mystic Dawn, fragrant smoke veiled the light; wafting perfumes purified the spirits, dispersing mist upon the Jade Capital. The Three Simplicities and Primordial Clouds trailed like lightning across rosy peaks; radiant splendor intertwined, and divine candles merged their brilliance. Ten billion maidens and immortals attended, while venomous dragons and colossal beasts guarded the numinous precincts. Pythons clashed swords, long-fanged beasts struck bells; celestial majesty blazed, transforming the Great Nonbeing. The Eight Winds stirred the Mystic Banners, jade tones resounded from the Numinous Palace. Phoenixes sang beside the Nine Rosy Clouds, simurghs chanted near the Purple Empyrean. Profound mists billowed above the Darkly Mysterious, and the first dawn’s light rustled in their midst.

Then the Heavenly Emperor Lord, the Supreme Prime Lord of the Southern Culmen, the Heavenly Emperor Lord of the Supreme Tenuity, and the Golden Portal Emperor Lord of the Nine Mysteries of the Latter Sage purified themselves for three months, gazing upward to receive the Great Obscurity. Their profound contemplation moved the Great Stillness; their accumulated thoughts opened the Upper Clarity. Thus, luminous radiance settled, the Nine Wefts entwined their forms; hidden mushrooms budded in splendor, and night-born treasure lights arose. They feasted on the essence of flowers, absorbed the morning essence, rode the void to weave mists, and the Eight Paths shone brightly. Chewing the Supreme Harmony, their wisdom flowed through the jade tablets; they wandered the subtle and obscure, drifting through the courts of the empyrean. Vast and boundless, the cavernous source stretched across infinite eons. They roamed the Great Transformation, their divine splendor inexhaustible.

Dwelling in the numinous observatory, they feasted in the Seven Dawns; purified in the Flowery Garden, they rested in the Nine Mysteries. Transforming their forms in the Jade Void, they led the hosts of heavens. The Two Sequences were vast and bright; primordial blessings flowed like boundless streams. Their gaze spanned kalpas, their aspirations transcended return. Bathing in the Numinous Mound, on the fragrant peaks of orchid purity, their luminous models were established, their inner harmonies complete. The Five Flowers illumined the treasury; their jade hearts gleamed with crystalline purity. In the secluded abode of profound radiance, purple light suffused their robes. They brandished their staffs at the Mystic River, plucked crimson blossoms from the Grove of Wisdom, and surveyed the vast expanse. Their eyes beheld the sounds of the Ten Heavens; their ethereal traces were formless and untraceable. Once the numinous transformation was concealed, they rode the movement of the Mystic Clarity. Branches flourished in pure harmony; empty wombs took form. The wondrous vision of Great Existence unfolded in the Simplicity and Numinous; the secret mysteries of the Nine Heavens congealed the essence of the Primordial Cavern. It ordered the Three Passes within the hidden palace, gathered the myriad Perfected in future lives, regulated the dark statutes to restrain transgressions, and redeemed one’s faults in the Great Obscurity. It delivered the seven ancestors from the Three Wretched Paths and liberated the destitute souls in the Southern Court. Chanting the wisdom hymns of the Three Emperors, it purged the defilements of the Three Clarities.

How great are the jade tablets! The utmost numinosity of divine power.

*The Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Scripture of the Great Cavern* are the Dao’s banner of the Supreme Sovereign, the wondrous chapters of the Purple Dawn. They command the ranks of the Nine Heavens, summon the spirits of the Five Emperors, blend the revolving winds in harmonious fusion, and congeal the Nine Revolutions in the Mystic Essence. They unite the feminine and masculine, transforming and harmonizing the myriad spirits. Profound and dense, their jade tones resonate with the Supreme Perfected. They operate beyond the Bright Beam, communicate transformations through the Mystic Gate, wield the blade of cavernous power to create wonders, and bathe in radiant nets to illumine the clouds. The Great Desert becomes the qi of the Numinous Pass; the Blade-less marks the years of the Vast Kalpa. Towering is the divine abode, the abyss of the myriad Perfected. The Golden Chamber blazes in splendor, luxuriant in the Upper Clarity. Its purport is subtle and obscure, difficult to fathom in detail.

If one can maintain long-term purification, sever worldly attachments upon entering the gate, recite the jade tablets in seclusion, and strike the jade tones to shake the numinous, then the Perfected will inscribe one’s name in the Eastern Florescence, the Seven Mysteries will be further moistened in the Purple Court. One will command demon kings with divine might and enlist the Five Emperors to guard the body.

This is the marvelous and divine power of the Great Cavern, which gathers the myriad Dao to return to life. Those without extraordinary bones or jade names—those of common constitution—must not rashly reveal the numinous scripture. Its prohibitions follow *The Luminous Regulations of the Nine Perfected*; the recipient must be cautious.

*The Supreme Jade Register Scripture of the Feminine One and the Five Elders* contains twelve upper vows, eight mysteries of the Primordial Mother, nine revolutions and five returns, transformations of the feminine and masculine. The second rare text, the ultimate chapter of the Most High, harmonizes myriad transformations, ensuring the enduring governance of destiny. It solidifies the hun-soul and congeals essence, commanding and gathering the host of spirits. It unties knots, releases bonds, and returns the Five Penetrations to their origin. The myriad qi converge and ascend to guard the Muddy Pellet. It refines and infuses the utmost Perfected, its splendor illuminating the Purple Court. It soars and shines in the Nine Mysteries, flows brilliantly in the Jade Clarity. Numinous mists scatter fragrance upon the bright rosy clouds; divine lamps glow radiantly in the Great Void. The host of Perfected rejoice in the jade chambers; the multitude of immortals chant praises and pay homage to the scripture. Flying beasts leap in the Great Void; simurghs and phoenixes warble in sorrowful song. The Three Luminaries pause their radiance; celestial brilliance merges with the daylight. Vast and boundless is the secluded abode—the utmost Perfected of the Most High.

chunks.original_text: 其旨虚鲜，洞趣幽深，妙不可记，理难可穷，若有玉挺，名系玉皇，东华奏札，列于琼宫，当得此文。 依科修行，精思天真，长斋苦念，日中乃餐，诵咏宝章，演究灵篇，九年不怠，乃得造真，炼魂魄於九府，理混合於三关，拔七祖於幽涂，度苦魂於南宫，告形坛以要感，誓信心以求仙。 此之妙化，影响降晨，乘虚逸霄，游宴无间也。 太上曰：兆之为道，存思《大洞真经三十九章》，回风混合雌一五老，金华洞房帝君十二上愿，玄母八门行间，太一变化雌一上仙之法，行事之日，每当先自清斋，沐浴兰香，入室内思素灵五帝，元洞洞天、洞地、洞渊之官宝名内字，招真致灵之道，事毕，然后得修大洞雌一宝诀。 其法玄微，与炁同生，与天同存。 是故太一紫房为混合元父、玄母，以三胎为神明秘言要妙，以九真名为内经大洞，以高上为元始大丹，以雌一为内精，大有之妙经，素灵为洞玄，总三宝为奇文，结三炁为高章，其妙不可测，高不可攀，深不可极，巍巍微哉，斯玉篇之有大德矣。 子能勤思，则白日升天，不死之道，二极於灵文也。 洞天混化内真变生宫号宝名 太上神仙洞天元洞元明元曜延灵耀元君，讳玄混，字灵元，头冠飞晨宝冠，衣青锦单裙，手执阳霞朱明之符。 太上神仙洞天元洞青耀少阳启明天君，讳常君，字伯玄，头冠青冠建晨玉冠，衣青绫之裙。 太上神仙洞天元洞黄灵大丹炎熏光大赫太阳君，讳启明，字真威，头冠玄宝冠，衣黄云锦裙。 太上神仙洞天元洞东华太岁重华耀灵太仙元命君，讳始明，字混生，冠飞晨玉冠，衣单青飞裙。 太上神仙洞天元洞东极太元皇灵宝魂耀魄君，讳飞生，字守命，冠青精玉冠，衣飞青羽裙。 太上神仙洞天元洞岁星延崖青腰常阳玉女，讳惠精，字娥景，头作飞云髻，衣青罗飞裙。 太上神仙洞天元洞太阳耀灵南极丈人绛宫玉童，讳上玄，字升灵，头作三角云髻，衣青羽飞裙。 太上神仙洞天元洞景阳东皇青阳翠灵仙童，讳安来，字玄耀，头作三建云髻，衣青文羽裙。 太上神仙洞天元洞赤皇延龄娥容太丹赤圭玉女，讳承灵，字精微，头作颓云髻，衣朱文羽裙。 右洞天元洞之官，化生青赤二炁，混合自然之号，上治素灵宫中清微之府，下治兆身上元泥丸宫中。 阳霞朱明之符 洞地混化内真生官宝名 太上神仙洞地洞真太荧惑大洞元生大灵机皇君，讳景化，字元精，头戴朱宝三梁之冠，衣绛章单衣，手执通明四洞九元之符。 太上神仙洞地洞真南阳炎域元执法延寿司箓君，讳度生，字延正，头冠玄云宝冠，衣丹文裙。 太上神仙洞地洞真中耀五阳五阴中皇洞极玄天太虚君，讳无穷子，字运度，冠远游冠，衣丹锦裙。 太上神仙洞地洞真中镇耀灵太上高皇君，讳承天，字胤元，冠飞晨冠，衣朱衣飞裙。 太上神仙洞地洞真南极太赤皇灵宝魂耀魄君，讳玄固，字无终，冠玉精宝冠，衣绛章单衣。 太上神仙洞地洞真皇衡赤阳绛章通灵仙童，讳龄期，字升幽，冠通天玉宝之冠，衣绛文飞裙。 太上神仙洞地洞真太镇元黄太素黄机执中五玉童，讳法华，字娥先，作飞云角髻，衣黄罗裙。 太上神仙洞地洞真镇星元神神耀玉□泰素中黄素玉女，讳道炁，字太宗，作颓云髻，衣黄罗飞裙。

Its purport is subtle and rare, its profound subtleties abstruse and deep—so wondrous it cannot be recorded, so recondite its principles cannot be exhausted. Should one possess the Jade Tablet inscribed with the name of the Jade Sovereign, and should the Eastern Florescence present its memorial, listing it within the Jasper Palace, then one may obtain this scripture. Following the prescribed rites, cultivate with concentrated devotion to the Celestial Perfected; maintain strict fasting and ardent recitation, taking meals only at midday. Chant the precious chapters, expound and delve into the numinous scrolls. After nine years of unremitting practice, one may attain the Perfected. Refine the hun and po within the Nine Palaces, harmonize and unify the Three Passes. Deliver the seven generations of ancestors from the dark paths, ferry the suffering souls from the Southern Palace. Make vows before the altar of form to invoke response, pledge sincerity of heart to seek transcendence.

Through this wondrous transformation, resonance descends at dawn. Riding the void, one soars through the heavens, roaming and feasting without hindrance.

The Most High declares: For those who pursue the Dao, contemplate the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern Perfected Scripture*. Circulate the wind to merge with the Feminine One and the Five Elders; invoke the Twelve Supreme Vows of the Golden Flower Cavern Chamber Emperor Lord; traverse the Eight Gates of the Mysterious Mother; and practice the method of the Great One’s transformation into the Feminine One, ascending as an immortal. On the day of practice, one must first purify through fasting, bathe with orchid fragrance, and enter the chamber to visualize the Primordial Numinous Five Emperors, the secret names and inner characters of the officials of the Primal Cavern Heaven, Cavern Earth, and Cavern Abyss. Only after completing these invocations may one proceed to cultivate the precious formula of the Feminine One of the Great Cavern.

Its method is arcane and subtle, coeval with qi, enduring as heaven itself. Thus, the Purple Chamber of the Great One serves as the Primordial Father of Fusion, the Mysterious Mother; the Three Wombs constitute the secret and wondrous words of the divine luminaries; the Nine Perfected Names form the *Inner Scripture of the Great Cavern*; the Most High is the Great Elixir of the Primal Beginning; the Feminine One is the inner essence; the *Wondrous Scripture of Great Possession*; the Primordial Numinous is the *Cavern Mystery*. Together, the Three Treasures compose the marvelous scripture; the Three Qi are bound into the exalted chapter. Its wonders are unfathomable, its heights unattainable, its depths inexhaustible—how majestic and subtle! This jade scroll possesses great virtue.

Should the disciple diligently contemplate it, they shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight, attaining the Dao of immortality. The two poles of existence are perfected within this numinous scripture.

**Cavern Heaven: Fusion and Transformation of the Inner Perfected—Palace Titles and Sacred Names**

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Heaven, Primal Cavern, Primal Radiance, Primal Brilliance, Prolonged Numinous Brilliance, Extended Prime Lord: personal name *Xuanhun*, style *Lingyuan*. He wears the Flying Dawn Precious Crown and a robe of azure brocade, holding the Vermilion Brilliance of the Yang Rosy Clouds.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Heaven, Primal Cavern, Azure Brilliance, Lesser Yang, Inaugural Brightness Heaven Lord: personal name *Changjun*, style *Boxuan*. He wears the Azure Crown with the Jade Dawn Diadem and a robe of azure damask.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Heaven, Primal Cavern, Yellow Numinous, Great Elixir, Scorching Radiance, Great Resplendent, Grand Yang Lord: personal name *Qiming*, style *Zhenwei*. He wears the Mysterious Treasure Crown and a robe of yellow cloud brocade.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Heaven, Primal Cavern, Eastern Florescence, Grand Year, Double Brilliance, Numinous Brilliance, Grand Transcendent, Primal Destiny Lord: personal name *Shiming*, style *Hunsheng*. He wears the Flying Dawn Jade Crown and a robe of azure flying silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Heaven, Primal Cavern, Eastern Culmen, Grand Primal, August Numinous, Treasure of the Soul, Brilliance of the Po Lord: personal name *Feisheng*, style *Shouming*. He wears the Azure Essence Jade Crown and a robe of azure feathered silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Heaven, Primal Cavern, Year Star, Extended Cliff, Azure Waist, Constant Yang Jade Maiden: personal name *Huijing*, style *Ejing*. She wears a Flying Cloud Coiffure and a robe of azure gauze.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Heaven, Primal Cavern, Grand Yang, Numinous Brilliance, Southern Culmen, Venerable Elder of the Crimson Palace, Jade Youth: personal name *Shangxuan*, style *Shengling*. He wears a Three-Cornered Cloud Coiffure and a robe of azure feathered silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Heaven, Primal Cavern, Scenic Yang, Eastern August, Azure Yang, Emerald Numinous Transcendent Youth: personal name *Anlai*, style *Xuanyao*. He wears a Three-Tiered Cloud Coiffure and a robe of azure patterned feathered silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Heaven, Primal Cavern, Vermilion August, Prolonged Longevity, Lovely Countenance, Grand Elixir, Vermilion Jade Maiden: personal name *Chengling*, style *Jingwei*. She wears a Falling Cloud Coiffure and a robe of vermilion patterned feathered silk.

The officials of the Primal Cavern Heaven transform and generate the azure and vermilion qi, fusing them into natural designations. Above, they govern the Primordial Numinous Palace within the Clear Subtlety Prefecture; below, they govern the Upper Prime Muddy Pellet Palace within the disciple’s body.

**Vermilion Brilliance of the Yang Rosy Clouds**

**Cavern Earth: Fusion and Transformation of the Inner Perfected—Palace Titles and Sacred Names**

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Earth, Cavern Perfected, Grand Blazing Star, Great Cavern, Primal Generation, Grand Numinous Mechanism August Lord: personal name *Jinghua*, style *Yuanjing*. He wears the Vermilion Treasure Three-Ridge Crown and a robe of crimson damask, holding the Luminous Passage through the Four Caverns and Nine Primes.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Earth, Cavern Perfected, Southern Yang, Scorching Realm, Primal Enforcer of the Registers, Prolonged Longevity Lord: personal name *Dusheng*, style *Yanzheng*. He wears the Mysterious Cloud Treasure Crown and a robe of cinnabar-patterned silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Earth, Cavern Perfected, Central Brilliance, Five Yang, Five Yin, Central August, Cavern Culmen, Primal Heaven, Grand Void Lord: personal name *Wuqiongzi*, style *Yundu*. He wears the Far-Wandering Crown and a robe of cinnabar brocade.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Earth, Cavern Perfected, Central Pillar, Numinous Brilliance, Most High August Lord: personal name *Chengtian*, style *Yinyuan*. He wears the Flying Dawn Crown and a robe of vermilion flying silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Earth, Cavern Perfected, Southern Culmen, Grand Vermilion August, Treasure of the Soul, Brilliance of the Po Lord: personal name *Xuangu*, style *Wuzhong*. He wears the Jade Essence Treasure Crown and a robe of crimson damask.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Earth, Cavern Perfected, August Balance, Vermilion Yang, Crimson Chapter, Numinous Passage Transcendent Youth: personal name *Lingqi*, style *Shengyou*. He wears the Heaven-Penetrating Jade Treasure Crown and a robe of crimson patterned flying silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Earth, Cavern Perfected, Grand Pillar, Primal Yellow, Primordial Yellow, Yellow Mechanism, Central Upholder, Five Jade Youths: personal name *Fahua*, style *Exian*. He wears a Flying Cloud Angular Coiffure and a robe of yellow gauze.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Earth, Cavern Perfected, Pillar Star, Primal Spirit, Numinous Brilliance, Jade [ ], Primordial Yellow, Primordial Jade Maiden: personal name *Daoqi*, style *Taizong*. She wears a Falling Cloud Coiffure and a robe of yellow gauze.
chunks.overlap_context: Clarity. Numinous mists scatter fragrance upon the bright rosy clouds; divine lamps glow radiantly in the Great Void. The host of Perfected rejoice in the jade chambers; the multitude of immortals chant praises and pay homage to the scripture. Flying beasts leap in the Great Void; simurghs and phoenixes warble in sorrowful song. The Three Luminaries pause their radiance; celestial brilliance merges with the daylight. Vast and boundless is the secluded abode—the utmost Perfected of the Most High.

chunks.original_text: 右洞地洞真之官，化生赤黄二炁，混沌自然之号，上治素灵宫兰台府，下治兆身绛宫之中。 通明四洞九元之符 洞渊洞玄混化内真生官宝名 太上神仙洞渊洞玄太白留金城耀耀元精元导太先君，讳浩田，字极元，冠玄晨玉宝冠，衣素锦飞裳，手执启明通天宝符。 太上神仙洞渊洞悬太白浩素天机星光君，讳混精，字浩真，冠游云宝冠，衣素文飞裙。 太上神仙洞渊洞玄太白曜金光少阴昊元素上皇白人君，讳浩丹，字正纶，冠玄晨冠，衣白锦飞裙。 太上神仙洞渊洞玄太辰玄洞元阴五耀延灵元华郁单君，讳北浩，字停渊，冠通天之冠，衣玄云锦裙。 太上神仙洞渊洞玄耀黑洞玄门太极五岳仙君，讳法容，字白元，冠玄晨冠，衣玄文单裙。 太上神仙洞渊洞玄北极太仙元皇宝魄耀魂君，讳飞生，字升无，冠通天冠，衣玄衣。 太上神仙洞渊洞玄素耀阴晖元神太极元皇耀灵元化玉童，讳幽精，字变通，作飞云三建髻，衣素文裙。 太上神仙洞渊洞玄阴景西皇素灵仙玉童，讳冲渊，字北极，作颓云髻，衣玄锦飞裙。 太上神仙洞渊洞玄太白延影九导大洞承翼玉门金楼玉女，讳娥廉，字惠精，作颓云髻，衣白罗之裙。 右洞渊洞玄之官，化生白黑二炁，混沌自然之号，上治素灵宫皇堂府，下治兆身丹田之中。 启明通天宝符 太上道君守三元真一经 三洞之道，结自然之号，辅统三宝，《大洞真经》、《雌一五老》、《大有素灵》，应承三元，元洞主天，洞真主地，洞玄主人，三炁合明，同治兆身三宫之中，相须乃成。 兆欲不死，当寻本生，服御流霞，以洞为先。 凡修三宝上清真经，当先思三洞内真宝名，存念官号，以卫身形，然后修行，克成真人。 其法至妙，秘在大有素灵宫中。 兆有骨分，当勤行道真，每自苦念，清斋兰香，不犯秽炁，神自见形，一十八年，降致绿軿，乘云控龙，白日升玄。 今以告兆，秘而奉行。 常以平旦思洞天，日中思洞地，夜半思洞渊，亦可日中顿思三真。 存思之法：入室东向，叩齿三十二通，先瞑目思素灵宫清微府中，青炁、赤炁相沓郁郁，来下入兆身中泥丸上宫，便咽九炁，次思兰台府中，赤黄二炁相沓如先，来下入兆身降宫之中，便咽九炁。 次思皇堂府中，白黑二炁相沓如先，来下入兆身脐#3下丹田宫中，便咽九炁。 咽三洞炁毕，便仰咒曰： 天地混沌，洞渊三精，元始结化，五炁混生，变化玄元，灌注身形，服御流霞，升入紫庭，北帝落死，东华记名，洞达幽微，与帝合并。 毕，又叩齿九通，思元洞元明元曜延灵耀元君玄混，以阳霞朱明之符，授与我身。 次思洞天生官，衣服讳字如上法，并从素灵宫清微府中下，以次入兆身泥丸宫中。 毕，仰祝曰： 洞天上元，监御九玄，总统三炁，混生丹田，披洞幽关，出入无间，魂魄宝耀，缠络华鲜，飞云绛室，游宴紫天，齐保天地，长享亿年。 洞天毕，次南方，向南思洞地洞真大荧惑星大洞元生大灵机皇君景化，以通明四洞九元之符，以授我身。 次思洞地生官，衣服讳字如上法，并从素灵宫兰台府，下入兆身绛宫中。 便仰祝曰： 洞地中元，总领飞仙，华冠宝耀，腰青建巾，授我灵符，通真致神，洞思幽微，受帝秘言，解胞散结，九孔朗然，七祖咸脱，上升南轩，云舆下降，白日升晨。

The offices of the Cavern Earth Cavern Perfected transform and give birth to the red and yellow *qi*, bearing the title of Primal Chaos and Spontaneous Nature. Above, they govern the Plain Spirit Palace and Orchid Terrace Mansion; below, they govern within the Vermilion Palace of the adept’s body.

The Luminous Four Caverns and Nine Origins Talisman
The Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious Transformative Inner True Birth Offices’ Treasured Names:

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious Great White Retaining Metal City, Radiant Primordial Essence, Primordial Guide, Grand Prime Lord: personal name *Haotian*, style *Jiyuan*. He wears the Dark Dawn Jade Treasure Crown and a robe of plain brocade flying garments, and holds the Dawn-Luminous Heaven-Penetrating Treasure Talisman.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Suspended Great White Vast Plain Heavenly Mechanism Star Radiance Lord: personal name *Hunjing*, style *Haozhen*. He wears the Wandering Cloud Treasure Crown and a robe of plain patterned flying silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious Great White Shining Metal Light Lesser Yin Vast Primordial Plain Supreme August White Human Lord: personal name *Haodan*, style *Zhenglun*. He wears the Dark Dawn Crown and a robe of white brocade flying garments.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious Great Aurora Cavern Primordial Yin Five Radiance Extending Spirit Primordial Florescence Dark Lone Lord: personal name *Beihao*, style *Tingyuan*. He wears the Heaven-Penetrating Crown and a robe of dark cloud brocade.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious Radiant Black Cavern Mysterious Gate Supreme Ultimate Five Marchmounts Divine Lord: personal name *Farong*, style *Baiyuan*. He wears the Dark Dawn Crown and a robe of dark patterned plain silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious Northern Culmen Supreme Immortal Primordial August Treasured Soul Radiant Spirit Lord: personal name *Feisheng*, style *Shengwu*. He wears the Heaven-Penetrating Crown and a robe of dark garments.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious Plain Radiance Yin Brilliance Primordial Spirit Supreme Ultimate Primordial August Radiant Spirit Transformative Jade Youth: personal name *Youjing*, style *Biantong*. He wears a Three-Tiered Flying Cloud Coiffure and a robe of plain patterned silk.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious Yin Scenery Western August Plain Spirit Transcendent Jade Youth: personal name *Chongyuan*, style *Beiji*. He wears a Falling Cloud Coiffure and a robe of dark brocade flying garments.

The Most High Divine Immortal of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious Great White Extending Shadow Nine Guides Great Cavern Upholding Wing Jade Gate Metal Terrace Jade Maiden: personal name *Elian*, style *Huijing*. She wears a Falling Cloud Coiffure and a robe of white gauze.

The offices of the Cavern Abyss Cavern Mysterious transform and give birth to the white and black *qi*, bearing the title of Primal Chaos and Spontaneous Nature. Above, they govern the Plain Spirit Palace and August Hall Mansion; below, they govern within the Cinnabar Field of the adept’s body.

The Dawn-Luminous Heaven-Penetrating Treasure Talisman

The Most High Dao Lord’s Scripture on Guarding the Three Origins and True Unity

The Dao of the Three Caverns forms the title of Spontaneous Nature, assisting in the governance of the Three Treasures. The *Great Cavern Perfected Scripture*, the *Feminine Unity Five Elders*, and the *Great Plain Spirit Numinous* correspond to and uphold the Three Origins. The Primordial Cavern governs Heaven, the Cavern Perfected governs Earth, and the Cavern Mysterious governs Humankind. The three *qi* unite in brilliance, jointly governing within the Three Palaces of the adept’s body, each requiring the other to achieve completion.

If the adept desires not to die, they must seek their original birth, ingesting and wearing the flowing rosy clouds, with the Cavern as their foremost priority.

In cultivating the Three Treasures and the Upper Clarity Perfected Scriptures, one must first contemplate the inner true treasured names of the Three Caverns, visualizing and invoking the office titles to guard the body’s form. Only then may one proceed with cultivation to successfully become a Perfected.

This method is most wondrous, its secrets held within the Great Plain Spirit Palace.

If the adept possesses the proper bone destiny, they should diligently practice the Dao of the Perfected, constantly enduring hardship in contemplation, maintaining purity with orchid incense, and avoiding defiled *qi*. The spirits will manifest their forms. After eighteen years, green carriages will descend, allowing one to ride clouds and command dragons, ascending to the heavens in broad daylight.

Now I reveal this to the adept; keep it secret and put it into practice.

Regularly at dawn, contemplate the Cavern Heaven; at midday, contemplate the Cavern Earth; at midnight, contemplate the Cavern Abyss. Alternatively, one may contemplate the Three Perfected at midday.

The method of visualization: enter the chamber facing east, knock the teeth thirty-two times, then close the eyes and visualize the Plain Spirit Palace and Clear Subtlety Mansion, where green and red *qi* intermingle in lush abundance, descending into the adept’s body and entering the Muddy Pellet Upper Palace. Then swallow nine *qi*. Next, visualize the Orchid Terrace Mansion, where red and yellow *qi* intermingle as before, descending into the adept’s body and entering the Vermilion Palace, then swallow nine *qi*. Next, visualize the August Hall Mansion, where white and black *qi* intermingle as before, descending into the adept’s body and entering the Cinnabar Field Palace below the navel, then swallow nine *qi*.

After swallowing the *qi* of the Three Caverns, raise the head and recite the incantation:
*"Heaven and Earth in Primal Chaos,
Cavern Abyss Three Essences,
Primordial Beginning knits transformation,
Five qi intermingle and give birth.
Mysterious transformation of the Primordial,
irrigating and infusing the body’s form.
Ingesting and wearing the flowing rosy clouds,
ascending into the Purple Court.
Northern Thearch records death,
Eastern Florescence inscribes the name.
Penetrating the subtle and obscure,
uniting with the Thearch."*

After reciting, knock the teeth nine times and visualize the Primordial Cavern Primordial Brilliance Primordial Radiance Extending Spirit Radiant Primordial Lord Dark Chaos, bestowing upon the adept’s body the Vermilion Brightness Talisman of Yang Rosy Clouds.

Next, visualize the birth offices of the Cavern Heaven, their attire, personal names, and styles as described above, all descending from the Plain Spirit Palace and Clear Subtlety Mansion into the adept’s Muddy Pellet Palace in sequence.

After visualizing, raise the head and pray:
*"Upper Origin of Cavern Heaven,
overseeing and governing the Nine Mysteries,
uniting and governing the three qi,
giving birth within the Cinnabar Field.
Unfastening the obscure passes of the Cavern,
entering and exiting without obstruction.
The soul and spirit treasure their radiance,
wrapped in resplendent adornments.
Flying clouds in the Vermilion Chamber,
roaming and feasting in the Purple Heaven.
Together preserving Heaven and Earth,
enjoying longevity for countless years."*

After visualizing the Cavern Heaven, turn to the south, face south, and visualize the Cavern Earth Cavern Perfected Great Fire Star Great Cavern Primordial Birth Great Numinous Mechanism August Lord Scenic Transformation, bestowing upon the adept’s body the Luminous Four Caverns and Nine Origins Talisman.

Next, visualize the birth offices of the Cavern Earth, their attire, personal names, and styles as described above, all descending from the Plain Spirit Palace and Orchid Terrace Mansion into the adept’s Vermilion Palace.

Then raise the head and pray:
*"Middle Origin of Cavern Earth,
overseeing the flying immortals,
adorned with resplendent flowered crowns,
girded with azure silk sashes.
Bestowing upon me the numinous talisman,
communicating with the Perfected to summon the spirits.
Contemplating the subtle and obscure,
receiving the Thearch’s secret words.
Dissolving the womb and dispersing knots,
the nine apertures become luminous.
The seven ancestors are all liberated,
ascending to the Southern Pavilion.
Cloud carriages descend,
ascending to the dawn in broad daylight."*

chunks.original_text: 洞地毕，转北向，存思洞渊洞玄太白子留金城耀耀元精元导太仙君，讳浩田，以启明通天宝符，以授兆身。 次思洞渊生官，衣服讳字如上法，并从素灵宫皇堂府，下入兆身脐下丹田宫中。 便仰祝曰： 洞渊幽关，上参三元，玄炁郁勃，飞霞紫云，流黄五色，华晨宝符，服御启明，与元长存，乘空驾虚，游宴玉晨，携提景皇，结友真仙。 洞渊毕，还东向，叩齿九通，咽液九过，三洞毕矣。 子能行之，真神见形，玉女可使，玉童致灵，三元下降，丹舆绿軿，来迎兆身，上升太清。 惟在宝秘，慎勿轻传。 太上道君守元丹上经 太帝君、天帝君、太微天帝君，受於太上道君，施行道成，上补帝真。 太帝君以经传西王母，天帝君以经传南极上元君，太微天帝君以经传金阙圣君，金阙圣君传上相青童君，青童君传涓子。 此素灵之上篇，此道奇於众经，其法高妙，非中仙所闻。 自无名书绛简，录字上清者，玄丹之道不相遇也。 道士若修太上三真品经，位为帝皇之上公、上卿也。 若所遭受者偏，闻道有限者，位为小有灵宫之王，神州之卿，太极中下大夫耳。 亦得骋龙驾云，乘飞控虚，神官导卫，散景八遐矣。 微乎深玄，难可轻宣也。 品经之目，出太上隐书八素篇中，有俯仰之格限也。 夫三一者，乃一身之灵宗，百神之命根，津液之山源，魂精之玉室。 是以胃池体方以受物，脑宫员虚而适真，万毛植立，千孔生烟，德备天地，混同太玄，故名之曰泥丸。 泥丸者，躯形之上神也。 兆唯知吞炁咽津，鸣齿纳液，而不知此所因者，乃泥丸之流沫，脑家之边枝耳。 今将告子守一之诀，上真之妙法也。 闭口奉修，慎勿宣传，负违盟誓，身没鬼官，考延七祖，长闭河源。 两眉间上，却入一寸为明堂宫，却入二寸为洞房，却入三寸为丹田。 丹田直上，辟方一寸，为玄丹脑精泥丸魂宫。 明堂宫中，左有明童真君，右有明女真官，中有明镜神君。 明童真君，讳玄阳，字少青。 明女真官，讳微阴，字少元。 明镜神君，讳照精，字四明。 此三君共治明堂宫，并着绿锦衣，腰带四玉铃，口衔玉镜，镜铃并如赤玉也。 头如婴儿，形亦如之，对坐俱向外面，或相向也。 此明堂之道也。 若道士恐畏，存三神，使鸣玉铃，使声闻太极，使口吐玉镜赤光，令万丈。 存之俱毕，因三呼三君名字，叩齿九通，则千妖伏息，万鬼灭形也。 若道士饥渴，亦存三君，并口吐赤炁，使灌己口中，因吸而咽之，须臾自饱也。 若道士夜行，暗不见路，又存三君，使口出三火光照前，须臾路自朗明也。 若行凶处厄难之中，有刀兵之地，急存三君，使鸣玉铃，精而想之，敌人自然心骇意慑，不复生害心也。 若道士欲求延年不死，及疾病临困，求救而生者，当正心安寝，存明堂三君，并向外长跪，口吐赤炁，使光贯我身，令匝我口傍，咽赤炁唯多无数，常闭目微咽之也。 须臾赤炁绕身，都变成火，火因烧身，身与火共作一体，内外向光，良久乃止，名曰日月炼形，死而更生者也。 又暮卧常当为之，则必长生不死也。 又数存咽赤炁，使人颜色返少，色如童女。 此不死之道，明堂之要诀毕也。 旦起皆咽唾三十过，以手拭面摩目，以为常存唾色作赤津夜。 洞房中有三真，左为无英公子，右有白元君，中为黄老君，三人共治洞房中。

Upon completing the Cavern Earth visualization, turn to face north and contemplate the Cavern Abyss’s Cavern Mystery Grand White Star, the Golden City’s Radiant Primordial Essence and Primordial Guide, the Grand Immortal Lord, whose personal name is Haotian, bestowing the Luminous Heaven-Piercing Treasure Talisman upon the adept’s body.

Next, visualize the birth offices of the Cavern Abyss, their attire, personal names, and styles as described above, all descending from the Plain Spirit Palace and Imperial Hall Mansion into the adept’s Cinnabar Field below the navel.

Then raise the head and pray:
*"Cavern Abyss’s hidden passes,
ascending to join the Three Origins,
mysterious qi surging forth,
flying auroras and purple clouds,
flowing yellow in five hues,
radiant dawn’s treasure talisman.
By its ingestion and adornment, the Primordial endures,
riding the void and mounting emptiness,
roaming and feasting in Jade Dawn,
accompanying the Luminous Thearch,
befriending the Perfected Immortals."*

Upon completing the Cavern Abyss visualization, return to face east, knock the teeth nine times, and swallow saliva nine times. The Three Caverns’ practice is now complete.

If the adept can perform this, true spirits will manifest, jade maidens may be commanded, jade lads will convey numinosity, the Three Origins will descend, and cinnabar carriages with green canopies will arrive to welcome the adept’s body, ascending to Grand Clarity.

This must be treasured in utmost secrecy—never transmit it lightly.

*The Scripture of Guarding the Primordial Cinnabar, Upper Scroll of the Supreme Dao Lord*

The Supreme Thearch, Heavenly Thearch, and Grand Tenuity Heavenly Thearch received this from the Supreme Dao Lord. Through its practice and attainment, they ascended to supplement the Thearch’s Perfected.

The Supreme Thearch transmitted the scripture to Queen Mother of the West; the Heavenly Thearch transmitted it to the Supreme Origin Lord of Southern Culmen; the Grand Tenuity Heavenly Thearch transmitted it to the Sacred Lord of the Golden Portal. The Sacred Lord of the Golden Portal transmitted it to the Azure Lad, the Prime Minister; the Azure Lad transmitted it to Master Juan.

This is the Upper Scroll of the Plain Spirit—this Dao surpasses all other scriptures. Its method is lofty and wondrous, beyond the ken of middling immortals.

Since the nameless text was inscribed on crimson bamboo slips and recorded in the Highest Clarity, the Way of Mysterious Cinnabar has never been encountered elsewhere.

If a Daoist cultivates the *Three Perfected Grades Scripture of the Supreme*, their rank shall be that of the Emperor’s highest ministers and chief counselors. If one’s reception is partial or their understanding of the Dao limited, their rank shall be as a king of the Lesser Spirit Palaces, a minister of the Divine Continent, or a grand master of the Grand Ultimate’s lower echelons. Yet even they may ride dragons and drive clouds, soar on wings and control emptiness, with spirit officials as escorts and radiant emanations dispersing to the eight directions.

Subtle and profoundly mysterious—this must not be lightly disclosed.

The titles of these graded scriptures emerge from the *Eight Plain Writings of the Supreme’s Hidden Books*, governed by the protocols of reverent posture.

The Three Ones are the spiritual essence of the body, the root of life for the hundred spirits, the mountain source of fluids and humors, the jade chamber of the ethereal soul. Thus, the stomach’s reservoir is square to receive things; the brain’s palace is round and void to accommodate the Perfected. A myriad hairs stand erect, a thousand pores emit mist, virtue fills Heaven and Earth, merging with Grand Mystery—hence it is called the Muddy Pellet.

The Muddy Pellet is the supreme spirit above the bodily form.

If the adept only knows how to swallow qi and ingest saliva, to knock the teeth and absorb fluids, yet does not understand their origin, these are but the overflow of the Muddy Pellet, the peripheral branches of the brain’s household.

Now I shall reveal to you the secret of guarding the One—the wondrous method of the Highest Perfected. Practice this with a closed mouth, and never disclose it. To violate this covenant is to be consigned to the ghostly bureaus, tormented for ages, with seven generations of ancestors bound in the Yellow Springs.

Two inches above the space between the eyebrows lies the Hall of Brightness; three inches within is the Grotto Chamber; four inches within is the Cinnabar Field. Directly above the Cinnabar Field, an inch-square space is the Palace of Mysterious Cinnabar, the brain’s essence, the Muddy Pellet, the soul’s abode.

Within the Hall of Brightness:
- To the left resides the Luminous Lad Perfected Lord, whose personal name is Xuanyang, style Shaoqing.
- To the right resides the Luminous Maiden Perfected Official, whose personal name is Weiyin, style Shaoyuan.
- At the center resides the Luminous Mirror Spirit Lord, whose personal name is Zhaojing, style Siming.

These three lords jointly govern the Hall of Brightness, all clad in green brocade robes, girded with belts bearing four jade bells. Their mouths hold jade mirrors, and both mirrors and bells resemble red jade. Their heads are like infants’, and their forms likewise. They sit facing outward or toward each other—this is the Way of the Hall of Brightness.

If the Daoist feels fear, visualize the three spirits, causing the jade bells to chime so their sound reaches the Grand Ultimate, and their mouths to emit red jade light for ten thousand yards. Once the visualization is complete, call the three lords’ names thrice and knock the teeth nine times—then a thousand demons will submit, and ten thousand ghosts vanish.

If the Daoist is hungry or thirsty, visualize the three lords, whose mouths emit red qi to fill the adept’s mouth. Inhale and swallow it, and soon you will be sated.

If the Daoist travels at night and the path is dark, visualize the three lords, whose mouths emit three beams of fire to illuminate the way, making the road bright and clear.

If traversing perilous places, beset by calamity, or in lands of blades and weapons, swiftly visualize the three lords, causing the jade bells to chime. Focus intently, and enemies will naturally be struck with terror, their intent to harm dissolved.

If the Daoist seeks longevity and immortality, or is afflicted by illness and near death, seeking deliverance, sit upright and rest calmly. Visualize the three lords of the Hall of Brightness, all kneeling outward, their mouths emitting red qi to envelop the adept’s body, encircling the mouth. Swallow the red qi without count, eyes gently closed. Soon the red qi will coil around the body, transforming entirely into fire. The fire will burn the body, merging with it into one, glowing within and without. After a long while, cease—this is called "Refining the Form with Sun and Moon," reviving the dead.

Practice this every night before sleep, and you will surely attain longevity and immortality. Frequently visualizing and swallowing red qi will restore youthful complexion, like that of a maiden. This is the Way of Undying—the essential secret of the Hall of Brightness is now complete.

Upon rising each morning, swallow saliva thirty times, wipe the face with the hands, and rub the eyes. Always visualize the saliva as red fluid at night.

Within the Grotto Chamber reside three Perfected:
- To the left is the Peerless Noble Son,
- To the right is the White Primordial Lord,
- At the center is the Yellow Elder Lord.

These three jointly govern the Grotto Chamber.
